body_html:
I realised jupyter is not installed in the tensorflow-gpu environment so I did conda install jupyter and now the --path shows the env. When I seeconda list I realize many packages missing and everytime I have to install, I have to download, which consumes data. Is there a way to download once and install into every new environment I create?
Btw, now TF can be imported in jupyter, but still not in spyder. I guess I need to download and install spyder in this environment again? (I feel like there is a better solution)

body:
I realised jupyter is not installed in the tensorflow-gpu environment so I did `conda install jupyter` and now the `--path` shows the env. When I see`conda list` I realize many packages missing and everytime I have to install, I have to download, which consumes data. Is there a way to download once and install into every new environment I create? 
Btw,  now TF can be imported in jupyter, but still not in spyder. I guess I need to download and install spyder in this environment again? (I feel like there is a better solution)
